page.title: 10TRAFFIC AND ROAD USE
page.content: Cars used to have to go through the Market Place but in 1975 a by-pass was built around Cirencester. London Road is one of the busiest roads in the town centre. The busiest time is from 9.15 am to 9.30 am when everyone is going to work whereas the busiest time on the by-pass is 11.30 - 11.45 am. When roadworks are in progress the traffic is diverted and the area is coned off. Most roadworks are caused by burst pipes, frost and car tyres wearing down the tarmacadam. Most schools have a lollipop lady outside to help everyone cross the road. The Green Cross Code is to help children cross the road safely. Most children in our school know it. Cirencester has a lot of traffic passing through as it is a meeting and crossing place of several major roads.
